file_content.text: Once the vaccine is ready, the Republic can start helping us reclaim our homes.
With those toxins dissipating, we'll soon be able to resume operations here.
Our sensors are already picking up traces of the formula in the soil. Just a matter of time before it completely eradicates those toxins.
And completely destroys the farmland.
Blame the Imperials, doctor, not us. Besides, a few lost parcels of land hardly compare to the threat of a global Imperial takeover.
I expect you to make sure the people here have some way to get food.
Don't forget the Balmorrans.
It won't be easy, but I'll certainly do what I can to see they get their supplies.
It wasn't an easy choice, but it had to be done.
This was necessary.
Few decisions in war are easy. But rest assured, you've done the Republic a great service today.
We finished?
Yes, you've already done more than enough.
Once the toxins have cleared and my men have recovered, we'll begin our assault.
I brought you the toxin samples.
I'm done.
Perfect! These ought to have everything I need to get started on that vaccine.
Just be quick about it.
Don't worry, you'll be butting heads with Imperials in no time, Major. And then we'll work on clearing out the toxins without damaging the soil.
When do you think the farmlands will finally be restored?
How long will that take?
Hard to say... we probably can't start until the Imperials are gone. But at least the option is there.
It all ends well...
Thank you for remembering that this war is about freeing Balmorra and not just one-upping the Imperials.
Don't forget who did the work.
Rest assured, plenty of Balmorrans will know you helped put food on their tables.
You showed a lot more insight than the rest of these Republic knuckleheads.
I hate to send you into such a contaminated area. Please be careful out there.
The irrigation center is well-guarded, so be on your toes.
Major, I really wish you'd think again.
I appreciate you patching up my men, doctor. But there's a reason civilians aren't looked to for military advice.
You, however, are just what the doctor ordered--so to speak. The Imperials are sitting on key targets, and my entire platoon's been poisoned.
How were your men poisoned?
Poisoned?
Are your men going to be alright?
Will they recover?
They're a few shades greener than healthy, but they should pull through--the ones who survived.
Imperials get the better of you?
The Empire wins again....
Only because they fight dirty.
The Imperials have turned the surrounding region into a toxic sinkhole. The vapors have been downing us.
The Empire dumped a whole mess of herbicides when they first invaded. Ruined an entire season's worth of crops.
Right... crops. Anyway, any troops I send are rendered helpless by the toxins before they're picked off by Imperial patrol droids.
Isn't there any way to protect yourself from the toxins?
Can't you counteract it?
We've tried everything: enviro-suits, armored transports.... Pretty remarkable for anti-vegetable weaponry.
Imperials normally kill people, not crops.
Why'd they poison the soil?
Take away our will by taking away our food. Turns out the toxin was nastier than they thought.
Why not cut your losses and move on?
Fight someplace else.
Not an option. This region is crucial to the Republic recapturing--ah, liberating--Balmorra.
Fortunately, we've cooked up a formula that'll burn those toxins out of the ground.
It'll get rid of the toxins, all right... and destroy the soil in the process.
These farmlands are some of the most fertile on Balmorra. The harvests are sold all over the planet. People will starve without them.
You're supposed to protect these people, not fight a war at their expense.
This is unacceptable, Major.
Their crops are useless now, anyway... unless there's suddenly a market for contaminated produce.
The Republic must put the welfare of innocents before its own ambitions.
Civilians come first.
That's what I say, but it's hard to be heard over the chest-thumping around here.
The Imperials need to be driven off, but does it have to be at Balmorra's expense?
It's a conundrum.
No matter how you look at it, we can't gain ground if the ground itself is killing us.
There's always people willing to bring in supplies for the right price.
Hire smugglers to bring food.
Importing food might work awhile, but what happens when the Sith blockade us? We need to stand on our own.
Do you have a better solution?
What other option is there?
Sometimes sacrifices are made.
Oh, rubbish. The Republic would rather break Balmorra than share it.
I know it's risky, but if you can get me samples of the toxins, I should be able to develop a workable vaccine for our soldiers.
We don't have time to play scientist. I need your help dispensing the formula we have. I can count on you, right?
I'm with the doctor on this one. Let's make that vaccine.
We need to save the farmlands.
I was starting to think the Republic had lost all sense. Thank you.
I'll need several soil samples. Also, the toxin may cause some... unpleasant side effects, so work quickly.
I'm with you, Major. This is war--we can't afford to hold back.
The military knows best.
Excellent. There's an Imperial irrigation center nearby we can use to pump the formula into the ground.
Just find the central computer terminal and use it to inject the formula into the pumps. The facility is heavily guarded, so be on your toes.
The Imperials seem intent on defiling this planet.
